title: Classic Ukrainian Borscht
short_description: A hearty, moderately caloric soup rooted in Ukrainian tradition, packed with vegetables and supported by a savory meat stock.
ingredients: 1/2 head of small cabbage, thinly sliced
Salt and black pepper, to taste

steps.title: Preparing the Meat Stock
steps.description: In a large pot, combine the beef with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, removing foam and fat as they rise. Cover and cook for approx. 60 minutes until the beef is tender.

steps.title: Cooking the Vegetables
steps.description: Add the cubed potatoes to the broth and cook for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a pan, add and sauté beets with vinegar, sugar, tomato paste, and a half cup of broth from the pot. After sautéing for about 7 minutes, entirely incorporate the sautéed beets, along with the carrots, onion, cabbage, and fresh tomatoes into the pot.

steps.title: Final Simmer and Seasoning
steps.description: Toss bay leaves, garlic, parsley, and dill into the pot. Bring the borscht to a boil and put the gas on low. Simmer for another 30 minutes. Season with black pepper, and additional salt if required.

steps.title: Serving the Borscht
steps.description: Serve hot with a spoonful of sour cream and a garnish of fresh dill in each bowl. Enjoy this national dish of Ukraine with rye bread.
